node.doctext:
This is a storage node for CST reviews. Reviews are moved her from our working area in [CST_Chat].

This archive begins on 02/04/06, When it's full we'll move to [CST_Storage_20].

See also CST Storage collabs [CST_Storage_1|1] - [CST_Storage_19|19].

-----------Batch Processed 02/04/06 by [GrouchyOldMan]------

Writeup Title:[unsatisfied]
Author:[Tlachtga]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: No.
Original Author's Permission received?: No.
Quoted content less than 33%: 100%
Compliance Assessment: No.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2006.1.24@22:35 [jessicapierce] says Seems like I remember guitar tabs being ok, right? But I’m not real clear on how they skirt the lyrics issue... i.e. [unsatisfied].
Hello Tlachtga, Paul Westerberg owns the copyrights to his guitar tablature and lyrics. Unfortunately E2 cannot keep work under copyright in its database. If you would like to update this so it meets [fair use] you may want to read through the [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material] for some suggestions and ideas. If you have any questions I would be more than happy to help you. Please let me know what you plan to do by Wednesday, February 1 ,2006. If I don't hear from you by then I'll assume you don't want to update and it will be removed. Kindest regards.
2006.1.25@21:28 [Tlachtga] says fine, kill it.
2006.01.25@21:28 [Tlachtga] says it's not worth trying to keep up wiht this shit.

Writeup Title:[Come Talk To Me]
Author:[lolaleigh] (last login 1.3 wk)
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: No.
Original Author's Permission received?: No.
Quoted content less than 33%: lyric count 357/43%
Compliance Assessment: No.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes:2006.1.24@22:31 [jessicapierce] says [Come Talk To Me] seems borderline.
Hello lolaleigh, Unfortunately this write up does not meet the E2 standards for copyright compliance. Lyrics are limited to 250 per song. At this time the lyric word count is 357. Additionally cited material cannot exceed 33% of the original content. At this time the cited material is 43% of the original work. Cutting down on the lyrics to meet fair use might take care of the cited material percentage. If you would like more information on how to node lyrics, you may want to read through the [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material] for further suggestions and ideas. Please let me know what you plan to do by Wednesday, February 1,2006. If I don't hear from you by then I'll assume you don't want to update and it will be removed. Kindest regards.
(User has logged in (4.8 days ago) and there was no reply. ) Hello again lolaleigh, It’s February 1, 2006. Unfortunately E2 cannot keep copyrighted works that don’t meet fair use in the database so this has to be removed. If you would like to update and resubmit it please make sure to read through the [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material |FAQ]. If you have any questions please feel free to ask, I will be more than happy to assist.

Writeup Title:[Everything Stops for Tea]
Author:[Junkill]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: No
Original Author's Permission received?: No.
Quoted content less than 33%: 17%
Compliance Assessment: Yes.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes:2006.1.24@21:36 Junkill says Hi there CST folks, it's me again! I have a writeup, currently on my scratchpad, entitled "Everything Stops for Tea" ... it uses a few stanzas from an obscure old 1930s musical movie, interspersed with essay and fun facts (Borgo-style)...I count 1,238 words (it's not final, but won't be much shorter than that), 214 of which are from the song. So, can I have a CST Approved tag for this bit of fluff?
Hello Junkill, Your fluffy lil write up has been reviewed by the [CST Team] and has passed with flying colors. You may append the [CST Approved] hard link!

Writeup Title:[Me up at does]
Author:[Kimonade]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: Still under copyright. First published in his 73 Poems (1963)
Original Author's Permission received?: No.
Quoted content less than 33%: No.
Compliance Assessment: No.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes:2006.1.23@18:29 [jessicapierce] says [Me up at does] - try as I might, I can't remember the ruling on cummings - though every other noded one I've found has original content.
Hello Kimonade, Unfortunately this poem was first published in Cunning’s 73 Poems (1963) and is still under copyright. Since the [E2 copyright changes] we have to remove any copyrighted work. If you would like to update this and resubmit it you may want to read through the [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material] for suggestions and ideas.

Hello Kimonade, Just a note to let you know that this poem was submitted to [Content_Salvage] for review. Because it was first published in 1919 it’s in the public domain. If you would like to you may append the following hard link [CST Approved] .

Writeup Title: [Letter: Son of Sam to Joseph Borrelli]
Author: [Uberfetus]
Reviewer: [GrouchyOldMan]
Public domain?: Yes
Original Author's Permission received?: No
Quoted content less than 33%: No
Compliance Assessment: Yes
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2006.01.16 at 23:33 jessicapierce says hello dood, wondering about status of [Letter: Son of Sam to Joseph Borrelli] and [Letter: Son of Sam to Jimmy Breslin]? Thanks much!
Hi there, I've been asked to review this work for E2 copyright compliance and I am assuming that your premise for posting these SoS transcripts is that they are available copyright-free via Public Domain. It that's not the case, please contact me. Cheers, - [GrouchyOldMan].
This transcript has been published widely in the media as well as on the net and is considered to be in the Public Domain. It is [CST Approved] on that basis, without any comment on it's overall merit.
Tc = 400, Tq = 377, %q= 94%

Hi there, I've been asked to review this work for E2 copyright compliance and based on your note I'm assuming that since this is your mother's work, you have the right to publish it on E2. Please let me know if that's not the case. Cheers, - [GrouchyOldMan].
[hokusai2908] claims to be the poet's son, so I'm giving this one a copyright pass based on "Permission Received"

Writeup Title: [Catullus]
Author: [brainwave]
Reviewer: [GrouchyOldMan]
Public domain?: No
Original Author's Permission received?: YES
Quoted content less than 33%: No
Compliance Assessment: No
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2006.1.11 (9.2 hr) Transitional Man says could you have the team take a look at a couple of the writeups in Catullus
Hi there, I've been asked to review this work for [E2 Copyright Changes|E2 copyright compliance] and I'm wondering what the source was for the translation?
2006.1.12 (29 min) brainwave says re Catullus: As it turns out you were quite right to be concerned about copyright. The translation is (c) 1995, Richard Bullington-McGuire. I have added attribution and written him asking for permission to republish it on e2. I will pass on his response or if you feel more comfortable nuke away. I am a 99.9% retired noder anyway : )
/msg brainwave Thanks for the quick response. I'd be delighted if Bullington-McGuire agreed, so why don't we give it a week or so to see. If not, I'll remove it. Okay?
2006.1.12 (16.7 hr) brainwave says I just got a response. He is a nice guy and has placed the translation under an Attribution+Noncommercial CC licence. see his website http://www.obscure.org/obscene-latin/catullus-42.html
Not to put to fine a point on it but, Far Fuckin Out! Please add the info to your wu and add the CST Approved tag. Good Job! :-)
Tc = 365, Tq = 160, %q= 43%

Writeup Title:[grapple in the apple]
Author:[Mardy]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: No.
Original Author's Permission received?: No.
Quoted content less than 33%: 95%
Compliance Assessment: No.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes:2005.12.29@3:23 (Content Editors) [Transitional Man] says what's the rule on transcripts [grapple in the apple] made me wonder when they can be used without copywrite violations
Hi there! According to the [http://www.seixon.com/blog/archives/2005/09/galloway_vs_hit.html|web site] cited as the source of this transcript in this write up, it’s under copyright. If you are interested in updating and resubmitting it so that it is copyright compliant you may want to read through the [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material] for some suggestions and ideas. If you have any questions please feel free to ask. I’ll be more than happy to assist.

2005.12.29@7:40 [Mardy] says I have provided about half of the transcript - this should be fair use for the public domain.

(Lometa says) The [http://www.seixon.com/blog/archives/2005/09/galloway_vs_hit.html|source] you cite states explicitly “TRANSCRIPT: This is a SEIXON EXCLUSIVE, must credit and must link!! COPYRIGHT © 2005 SEIXON ALL RIGHTS RESERVED” Even though it’s speech made over the airwaves the transcript is still the work product of the host and that's why it’s copyrightable.

One of the ways to work around this is to write the author of the blog and ask permission to reprint it here on E2. I think it would be a wonderful addition to the database. Here are a couple of [All-purpose, handy-dandy Copyright Release/Permission Request Form|request forms] that other noders have found useful.

Another way would be to make the write up meet the definition of fair use according to the rules established in the [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material|E2 FAQ]. Please read under the subheading, “Q. So can I use copyrighted material in my writeups?”

I know copyright is very confusing that’s why we offer the services of a copyright team here. Let me know what you decide to do and if you have questions please feel free to ask:)

Writeup Title:[How Long Copyright Protection Endures]
Author:[blowdart]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: Yes.
Original Author's Permission received?: Public domain.
Quoted content less than 33%: 71%
Compliance Assessment: Yes.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes:[jessicapierce] says 11.30 2005 at 15:41:12 Here's a cute one. I visited [How Long Copyright Protection Endures], thinking the content would almost certainly fit better under a less complicated title, like copyright. Then I realized both of the 2 wus contained there consist of less than 2/3 original content - they're mostly quoted snippets of other websites. This is not necessarily a problem but needs some checking up on. I sincerely hope that someone on staff feels like dealing with this.(Broken nodes)
Hello blowdart, Unfortunately since the [E2 copyright changes] we can no longer keep copyrighted work in the database. However when I visited the web site where this content came from there was no copyright notice. I am wondering if it is public domain since it is based on laws. I have emailed the Webmaster for some clarification and will update you when I find out. If there in no reply by December 7, 2005 this will have to be removed.
Hello again blowdart. I wrote an e-mail to the UK Patent Office and they directed me [http://www.patent.gov.uk/disclaimer.htm|here]. It says, “Where any of the Crown copyright items on this site are being republished or copied to others, the source of the material must be identified and the copyright status acknowledged (eg The UK Patent Office © Crown copyright 2002).” To the best of my knowledge this write up meets their criteria and is [CST approved].

Writeup Title:[Hymn to Ninkasi]
Author:[Angry Safer]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: No.
Original Author's Permission received?: No.
Quoted content less than 33%: 60%
Compliance Assessment: No.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes:[yclept]: 11/22/05 asked Angry Safer re: copyright status of the translation. I think Civil is still alive.
Hello Angry Safer, Miguel Civil is a Professor of Sumerology in Chicago, IL and owns the copyright on the translation of the hymn. Unfortunately E2 cannot keep work under copyright in its database. If you would like to update this so it meets [fair use] you may want to read through the [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material] for some suggestions and ideas. Please let me know what you plan to do by Saturday, September 26 ,2005. If I don’t hear from you by then I’ll assume you don’t want to update and it will be removed. Kindest regards.
2005.11.23@1:58 [Angry Safer] says [yclept] already pointed this out to me, I found another translation, thanks for the headsup, I hope I'm in the clear now.
Hello again [Angry Safer], The [http://www.beerchurch.com/index.html|home page] for the source cited for this translation notes that “all material” is under copyright. More than likely any translation written after 1923 will be under copyright. There are suggestions and ideas as to how to make this write up copyright compliant in the [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material]. I strongly suggest you read it.
Hello Angry Safer, It’s Saturday November 26, 2005. Unfortunately E2 cannot keep copyrighted works in the database so this has to be removed. If you would like to update and resubmit it please make sure to read through the [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material|FAQ]. Please prepare it on your [scratch pad] before submitting and I will be more than happy to help you out in any way I can.

Batch Processed 03/19/2006

Writeup Title:[The Aleph]
Author:[gounthar]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: Fisrt publication date 1949.
Original Author's Permission received?: No.
Quoted content less than 33%: 100%
Compliance Assessment: No.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes:2006-03-10@9:07 [princess loulou] says hi, would someone like to check the copyright situation on [The Aleph] by [gounthar]?

If you need any help, I’d be happy to assist.

Hello [blaaf], this write up and it’s companion piece has been submitted to the [CST_Group] and is compliant. You may append this hardlink [CST Approved] . Thank you!
Hello Walter, To answer your question about [The Yellow Wallpaper] and why it’s in two nodes. Oftentimes noders can choose to post in two nodes because putting a long short story in one can lead to loading problems with some users who own computers don’t allow the whole page to download.
